alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 1:04PM AKST until December 29 at 4:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and snow expected. Total ice accumulations of up to one quarter of an inch. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches, mainly north and east of Palmer. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 4 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely hazardous, including during the evening commute. Be prepared for slippery roads. Ice accumulation may cause downed power lines and falling tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light freezing rain will develop this afternoon, then become heavier during the evening hours. Precipitation will change to snow during the late evening hours, then quickly end from west to east.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
